< text>
Rushed here for emergency care for our dear dog Kiba who had collapsed, not breathing. We got him breathing again, got him here and they took him in immediately. They kept us updated very regularly, every 15-20 mins. Even though they did not expect him to make it, they continued keeping him going per our requests, until finally after about an hour and a half we made the decision, based on their excellent sharing of information and prognosis, to let our little guy go. It was expensive, but I felt the quality of care was outstanding, as well as the empathy expressed and the process of saying goodbye in the private area behind the clinic. They helped us through such a traumatic experience.<//text>

So I went to Silicon Valley for an opinion and the Dr. who saw Mickey said, we could spend about 4-7 thousand to try but , I really think you have done a good job keeping him alive for as long as you have, it may be time to say good bye. <text>What a scam! They would take advantage of pet owner to buy services and tests they totally don't need.

My mom's dog didn't pee for roughly 32 hours, so she's worried. I didn't think it was a big deal, but I find her this clinic anyway so she can feel safe. I thought they would give her some meds to help with digestion. They took our dog inside, did some routine check and suggested my mom to do an X-ray on the spine and some additional blood test, which cost roughly $1800. Are you serious? The dog didn't pee for a little over a day and you want to check his spine? He was still running and jumping around and you can't see that? I think the doctor is taking advantage of my mom's emotion and some language barrier. I thought it was outrageous so I told my mom to not do it. The doctor then gave her some meds to help with upset stomach, which was what I sent my mom to get in the first place. Total cost was a little over $180, which included a visit fee of $150, which I think its also overpriced compared to a lot of the other clinics I visited. Oh btw, the dog did end up pee a lot while waiting for the diagnosis in the clinic, and the doctor still wanted to do an X-Ray.

I think this place will try to scare pet owner to sell any service they can think of to rip you off and make profit. Please call ahead and ask for potential issue and cost before you visit.< /text>< date>

WARNING!!!! NEGLIGENCE!!!! We took our dog for emergency care to Med Vet Silicon Valley located at 7160 Santa Teresa Blvd, San Jose Ca 95139. Our dog had been bitten by another dog.  Before leaving our house we cleaned the deep wound that was actively bleeding, stopped the bleeding and bandaged him properly. We arrived at Med Vet Silicon Valley at approximately 4:50 pm.  We called the  number that we were told to call and filled out the online form. A technician came out and took our dog in.  Our home is about 40 minutes away depending on traffic and our phones were on low percentage with our chargers at home. After approximately 30 minutes of waiting we received a phone call from the veterinarian she explained to us that she wanted to do bloodwork, do xrays, heavily sedate our dog and clean the wound.  We asked her why all this was necessary and she gave us a vague response lecturing us that is needed to be done and that they would call us for an estimate of cost.  We asked more questions and how long it would take and her response was well into the evening and they would call for an estimate.   We waited approximately 20 minutes with no chargers and phones starting to die we went to the door and a technician came out after another 5 minutes we told them our situation and that we only wanted our dog to be treated for the wound. He said he would need to talk to the doctor. After another 10 minutes I called and explained the situation. The technician said someone would call us.  After another ten minutes I went to the door and talked to the technician again and told her the doctor will want to talk to you.  We waited another ten minutes and at that point decided we needed to seek care elsewhere.  We waived down another technician explained we would be seeking care elsewhere. She said that is fine I will be right back.  Another 15 minutes passed and no one came out finally any Tech came to talk to someone else and we told them if we could have our dog. She went back inside. 10 minutes later a tech comes out with our dog and I notice immediately that his bandage has been removed and he is bleeding.  The tech with bright pink hair and a major attitude said that will be 200 dollars. At that point I ask for what my dog is bleeding al ot and had no bandages on them. That is negligence!. She refuses to give us our dog and ask us for a card. I then told her I'm not paying that you didn't do anything my dog is bleeding. The girl with bright pink hair said "whatever" and hands us our dog.  Thankfully we were able to rush our dog to a family friend that lives about ten minutes away and they gave us a first aid kit to stop the bleeding and bandage the wound.  We went to another facility and were able to take our dog take care of. Med Vet 7160 Santa Teresa Blvd, San Jose Ca 95139 showed complete negligence with not bandaging our dog or taking care of them. The other place said there was absolutely no need for heavy sedation or x-rays, treated our dog and we have follow up in a few days. We didn't have time to read the reviews for Med Vet before we went, but now after reading it our experience seems in line with so many other people's experience of negligence and scamming at Med Vet. The pictures show how they let my dog leave and they would not bandage them or even give us back the bandages we had on him.</Text>

< review>
We would definitely recommend Dr Clare; she was professional and showed compassion.

<rate>1</rate><Text>I had a pet emergency and was told this was the closest place for a walk in. I called to find out the price was minimum 150 and first come basis, so no appointments. I understand that.
I took my cat in and was told over the phone what they thought and what I needed to do. (It was about an hour wait. Not bad at all.) They said they would prescribe oral antibiotics and pain medication to take home that lasts 2 weeks so I would need to call to see my primary vet for the rest of the treatment/surgery. I was unhappy with oral medicine since my cat was not eating and I already said she wouldn't let me see her mouth (The issue was dental so that makes sense). They said it was okay to squirt it in the corner of her mouth and should be fine. I insisted on asking for a shot instead and was told I they would have to ask. I got off the phone expecting a call back about that.
After hanging up with them, I called my vet to tell them what was going on and how they said I needed dental surgery. My vet was immediately disgusted that the medication was oral too! He said to call them and demand no treatment then bring the cat to him today (despite no appointment and he was close to closing). He said a cat not eating won't and shouldn't have oral medication and I was right to want a shot done.
I called MedVet again and they said they had my bill ready and would give me my cat. I was confused since they never contacted me back on treatment so I figured it was just the visit fee.. It was over $240! I asked for a breakdown and they charged the basic 150 with antibiotics and pain medication. They didn't call me back to say what treatment they were doing or anything. They just did what they wanted... Apparently they just gave my cat a shot without talking to me. It was what I asked for but completely rude to not even call me back about it or tell me price too. Certain animals might be allergic to medications! Important to talk to the client...
When they were checking me out, I mentioned wanting to know symptoms for the medications given to my cat (Without my actual consent considering they didn't tell me the medications or call me back after I said no to oral.) and was only told drowsiness or dizzy. I asked if I should look out for any bathroom issues like constipation or vomiting. They said no.... I know medications. They gave gabapentin which can do drowsiness and dizziness. However, they gave the antibiotic cefovecin which has side effects of vomiting, diarrhea, lethargy, and decreased appetite. I asked as a test and boy did they fail. Again!
Throughout the entire thing, it was like staff didn't talk to each other because they asked the same questions and responded differently when I asked them questions.
Me: I have my cats medical history papers with me in the car. I put them in the carrier case. Do you need them? I made copies for you to have.
Staff 1: "No we won't need the medical history and bloodwork."
Staff 2: "Oh you have that? Yeah. We need those."
Me: I brought the tooth that I found so the doctor can see it too.
Staff 1: Oh they won't need that.
Staff 2: We won't need that. Thanks for bringing it.
Staff 2 had to come back out to my car to get the tooth later.....
Overall, I was upset and just wanted my cat back. I paid the money and got the hell out of there after checking to make sure I at least got the right pet. They didn't even return the tooth for me to show to my vet... Not going back for it.
Tip: You can sort the Google reviews by "Newest" to see that there are a lot of bad reviews in the last year.  Wish I had looked at these prior to coming here.< /Text><Pictures>None< /Pictures>< resp>

< Text>
Had a terrible experience with this emergency vet.
After we found our dog started shaking and did not stop a few hours, we took her to this place. Doctor diagnosed it as potential disc disease, that was good part in terms of identifying the problem, but during her diagnose, she pushed back bone of my dog really hard and my dog cried so hard. I went home and put her on the ground first time after the diagnose, she could not hold her back legs any more. She was walking OK right before diagnose even she was shaking. We monitored our dog closely, but the situation was getting worse, within an hour, she lost her back legs control completely.
so we took her to this place again next day. She was already in a bad shape and needed surgery. The surgery was done in following day and when we saw her, she did not look she recognized us anymore. We thought its because a couple hours from surgery. But when we visited in the following day, she still could not recognize us. I did not like it, but doctor said its normal. Then when we visited again in the following day, my dog was laying down and could not move, then her eye focus was lost. They said she was still OK, "Normal"after surgery. I was not sure thats OK, but wanted to believe it. and we took her home since I thought its better for her to stay home to get recovered. To me my dog was losing all capability after surgery. Again when she got out this place, she did not stand even front legs, no focus on eyes, and could not generate voice even she tried hard. Of course she did not take any food. I was hoping the situation could get better once she got home, but that was totally wrong. She continued losing her vital rapidly and she passed away in the morning. Doctors, nurse, and staff are generally good, but I have to say my experience was terrible. I think the surgery destroyed nerve systems of my dog. My dog passed away 4days after surgery even we were told 50/50 chance of movement of back leg. No doctors explained potential death. btw I paid over $10,000 for 5 days.
All doctors and nurse are dealing with so many dogs and cats 24hours due to the nature of emergency vet, but I did not feel they communicate well upon each shift.  For example, I brought blanket for my dog, then found the other dog was using when we visited.  so sad. I do not know how good this place technically, but the end result was terrible for us. we lost a very important family member.</Text>

<user>113943234947268339222<//user><gmap_id>0x808e2fa527ad148b:0xe6566999db2b04e9< /gmap_id><name>Ga Tre<//name><Resp>None< /Resp><rating>1</rating>< Time>
1560026388179< /Time>
< text>
Our pets, we love them, right? It's the reason as to why all of you are willing to immediately go to an animal emergency care center when you learned that your pet's health is in danger. However, like many other things in life, you will find wretched scums who will try to exploit this innocent love. This place, is filled with these kind of people. I would've remained ignorant of this, if it weren't for the fact that I've experienced it firsthand for myself.

I have a cat, who swallowed a 1.5 inch needle. I wasn't certain he swallowed it at the time, so I immediately looked for an emergency care center, and ended up taking him here to get an x-ray. I paid $410 dollars out of my pocket, anxious to know the results. However, I ended up having to spend for an agonizing 2.5 hours, when they originally claimed that they could get it done in 30 minutes. When I asked why it took so long, they claimed that they were "busy," despite the fact that there were only two other patients.

The results came in, and it was confirmed: My cat did swallowed a needle. The worry on my face was obvious. One of the staff, seeing this, clearly wanted to exploit this, for he said that to get the needle removed "right now," it would cost more than $9000. Right after he said that, he shrugged, and gave another offer, which is to pay $5500 to get it removed tomorrow morning. If it weren't for the fact that a family member earlier told me that an emergency surgery would've costed approximately $1000 - $2000, I've fallen for this trap. The person showed no compassion as I got my cat back, needle still in his stomach. Before leaving, I asked for a copy of the x-ray image.  They said they will email it to me by 6AM next morning, but I've never received it.  I left the building, and looked back, only to see that same person laughing with the others. I knew then, that I absolutely cannot trust this place.

As I got home, I instantaneously looked for another location. That same day, I found a local vet in Evergreen, with a very straightforward doctor who offered that we pay $1500 for x-ray, needle removal, AND medicine, all in one package. I immediately took his offer, and now, my cat is jumping about once again, a needle gone from his stomach.

But, it wasn't over yet. Believe or not, this scam disguised as a hospital called me a week later in an attempt to milk even more money out of me, oblivious to the fact that my cat already made the recovery. It wouldn't take a genius to know that I hung up at the spot.<//text>
<pictures>None<//pictures></record></dataset><record>

< rate>
1< /rate>
< review>
All I can say is be sure to get a second opinion before having any surgery on your pet. Everyone at Silicon Valley Vet Specialists was very nice but Dr. Ryan Wheeler completely misdiagnosed our cat.  Our cat had severe swelling on the left side of his face, his eye was completely swollen shut and he had a fever. Dr. Wheeler diagnosed a mass behind the left eye and said the eye needed to be removed to access the possible tumor. We were told at best our cat was going to lose an eye, at worst the tumor was malignant and we were going to lose our beloved family pet. We took our cat to Dr Harika at Morgan Hill Animal Hospital for a second opinion. Dr Harika diagnosed an abscess in our cat's cheek, drained it and placed a few stitches and prescribed some antibiotics. Our cat is completely healed and happy again and still has his eye! Thank goodness we got that second opinion or our cat would have gone through totally unnecessary surgery and lost an eye for no reason.< /review>

< Text>
Keep your receipts!

I got a letter from a collections agency by the name of TSI.  Apparently, Affordable Pet Vet Clinic sent a claim on 3/16/21 to TSI indicating that I owed them $144.11 for pet services that took place over six years ago (11/28/14).  Of course I'm disputing this claim since I'm sure that I don't owe Affordable Pet Vet Clinic any money.  Additionally, I pay all my bills with a Credit Card and I'm 100% sure that I pay all my CC bill before they are due.

At any rate, this event is beyond frustrating since I don't keep my financial records for more than a couple of years and I'm having to waste time and effort to investigate an event that took place over six years ago.

Also, I called Affordable Pet Vet Clinic to have someone there provide me with evidence on the non-payment and I've not gotten a response.

In addition to this review with my cautionary note to potential Affordable Pet Vet Clinic customers, I'm following up with the Federal Trade Commission to determine how best to respond to this type of issue.

So, please keep your receipts from Affordable Pet Vet Clinic!<//Text>

< Time>
1457732434172</Time>
<Text>This vet saved our dog's life. Our English Bulldog, Thuggy, needed an emergency surgery for a pyometrea infection, and we were searching for a place to perform the operation for an affordable price, but kept getting turned away, or given prices that we couldn't afford. We called almost every veterinary hospital in the bay area proper, but none of them could do it for a price within our budget. We were getting worried that we may have to put our dog down, but then my husband did a Google search for "affordable veterinary care" and this place popped up first. We knew it was a long-shot, but we called, and the vet said that he could do the surgery right away, and gave us a decent price. We had about an hour drive ahead of us (we're in Oakland), but we knew this was our opportunity to save our dog's life, so we hopped in the car and drove as fast as we could. When we arrived, they assured us that our dog would be OK, and took our dog back immediately to start the surgery. The operation was done in about an hour and a half, and our dog survived! This was about a month and a half ago, and our dog is back to her happy, healthy self. This veterinary hospital is clean and bright, and operated by a kind, and caring staff. The doctor (Dr. Singh, I believe?) that performed the operation was a very kind man, and knew exactly what he was doing. This place actually cares about it's patients more than they do their bottom dollar, and that speaks volumes about their ethics. If you have a pet who needs emergency medical care, or even just a check up, this is your place. Your pets will be in good hands, and you won't leave there broke or disappointed. Thanks to them, my dog is now living happily, and will be with us for years to come. I couldn't thank them enough and will definitely recommend them to my friends who need veterinary care. ‚ô°<//Text>< rating>
5<//rating>

< Text>
I crave the arrabiata pasta everyday. Cozy atmosphere and plenty of street parking make this a great choice in Venice. Limited beer and wine selection so we usually being our own wine and pay the corkage fee. Can get really busy so I highly recommend getting reservations on something like Open Table. This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Los Angeles.< /Text>

<rate>5<//rate><text>Stopped by for the first time for a late lunch on Saturday after a day at the beach. We were seated immediately. There are a few small patio tables outside but we sat inside.
The service wasn't rushed and we were given time to    order drinks and appetizers before deciding on the entrees. Food service was leisurely which gave us time to enjoy our beer and beverages.
The food was absolutely delicious! Our table ordered the chicken marsala with mashed potatoes, pumpkin ravioli with butter sage sauce, and a spaghetti marinara. . The chicken was moist and the sauce was flavorful. The ravioli was tender and chewy and the sauce was balanced with sweet butter and herbs. The marinara sauce was fresh and creamy. All portions were generous. This is a nice little neigjborhood spot for families and dates.< /text><pictures>None<//pictures><Resp>None< /Resp><gmapID>0x80c2baeb9c9a2e0b:0xd679630946371f86< /gmapID></record></dataset><record>

< Text>
I am long over due for this review. I've been coming to this restaurant for four years and I never tire of it. Its a favorite for my kids and me
The food is superb, the service impeccable and the owners are absolutely charming and service oriented. I've brought my kids, dates and friends, all love the place.  Its that kind of place, enough ambiance for a romantic dinner yet comfortable enough to bring friends and family. The steak stuffed raviolis are to die for.   All the pastas are fantastic.  The Burrata Bruchetta is incredible! The servers I've had are wonderful, Grant is the consummate professional and Renee is warm and inviting. <Name>Juliana Stoyanova</Name><time>1488694824928<//time><rating>3< /rating><Review>Outstanding food but the manager is not as polite as he needs to be! We spend more than 2 hours and apparently it's not a good thing!</Review><Pics>None</Pics>< Resp>
{'time': 1489179407955, 'text': 'Unfortunately, it\'s not quite as simple as that:\nThis couple arrived for their 5:30 reservation on a busy Saturday evening. Not only were we fully booked, but most of our tables were \'stacked,\' meaning reserved for two or more seatings. Despite this, they told the Server that they didn\'t want the table they were assigned. They wanted a table large enough for a party of 4 so they could sit side by side. The server told them that while we could accommodate them, the table would have to be available by 7:15 (at the latest) for a 7:30 (party of 4) reservation. To this they replied "no problem, we\'ll be quick." An hour and 45 minutes later, I found myself at the table reminding them of the situation. He was not happy. He asked me what I was prepared to do (as Owner of the establishment) to rectify the situation. I offered to move them to the Bar. He asked about some of the unoccupied tables that surrounded them. At that point I realized that not only had he not listened to what the Server had said to begin with, he hadn\'t been  the least bit interested. I re-explained that those tables were reserved for various parties comprising of 8 guests, 10 guests & a Birthday party of 17 guests; all of which (at around 7:30) were about to arrive.\n\nOnce at the Bar, we proceeded to engage in (at least) an hour long debate on the proper way to run a Restaurant. You see, according to him he worked at and ran his fair share of restaurants in the past. Given his general behavior (raising his voice & at times using foul language), I doubt highly that this is true. Let\'s face it, if one has to explain the concept of \'turn-over\' times for tables etc., this person does not know about what they claim to know. Also, the fact that he threatened to not tip the Server as a result of all of this only solidifies the suspicion that this person has never run a Restaurant, let alone Served or Bartended.\n\nDuring this time at the Bar, he proceeded to approach other guests with faux apologies for their table not being ready upon their arrival, when in fact this particular quest had nothing to do with the situation. When I asked him why he was doing this, he replied with a few questions: "Is this against the law? Am I not free to speak to anyone I want? Isn\'t this a free country?" At the end of the day, this turned out to be a classic case of a person attempting to get something for free. Despite agreeing to giving up the table in time for the next reservation, he felt he should get something in return for \'being inconvenienced\' as it were. I say this, because on more than one occasion he pointed out that this all could\'ve easily been avoided if I\'d have just apologized (for what?!?) and at least offered him a 20% discount. I then realized that the time I\'d wasted (while attempting to attend to my other guests) & the unnecessary stress that myself & some of my staff endured was not worth the $106.58 check he was sitting on. I comp\'d their whole check in the hopes of putting and end to it and lo & behold... they were gone. I comp\'d their entire check. Not a free dessert or a glass of wine for each, I comp\'d their check. Yet, here I am defending myself in a public forum. In terms of Restaurants; we\'ve been in business for a very long time. By and large our Customers have always walked away very satisfied. Now, Juliana Stoyanova (the person who posted this review) didn\'t really have much to say during this whole exchange. However her companion did. I can only describe this person as selfish, unreasonable & opportunistic. We as business owners reserve the right to not serve any individual, whose presence we feel would be detrimental to our establishment. I wish I\'d known. As such, if you\'re reading this and are either an Owner, General Manager or an Assistant Manager, feel free to contact me privately & I\'d be more than happy to share more in the way of details. Hopefully you can avoid making the same mistake I did as a result.\n\nAlex Paez\nCentanni Trattoria'}<//Resp>

< user_id>
103379264202553362035< /user_id>
< text>
I've had an unusual uptick in cravings for Italian food this past year or so, and it definitely surfaced during my LA trip, where I'd otherwise usually only eat Asian food. Meeting up with a friend and her hubby for dinner, I ordered the pumpkin ravioli that they seemed to be well-known for, and also took advantage of their check-in offer for the free tiramisu at the end.

The ravioli, unfortunately, was a bit on the too sweet for me, which really shouldn't have been a surprise, given what the main ingredient was and all. That aside, the pasta was done well, and there was definitely good flavor to be had: I can only imagine how much more I would have enjoyed it if it had been done with meat and cheese instead. Having taken a bite of my friend's pesto gnocchi, I can say that was notably tastier.

The tiramisu, on the other hand, was delicious, and not just because it was free! I had actually taken it to go, and didn't get around to it a day or two later, and it was still quite tasty. Not the best I've had, by any means, and a little lacking in that rum flavor I enjoy, but still worth trying. And while it seems a bit pricy, you get a large enough portion to easily share between two.

I'm not sure how likely it is I'd come back though, all said. If I lived in the area, I might, but as an out-of-towner, I'd rather go to Fritto Misto instead.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - A mid-sized restaurant with accessible seating and adequate spacing between their tables.

Bathroom - Didn't try them, so no comment.<//text>

<user_name>Kevin Styer</user_name><Date>1597862553171<//Date>< rate>
4<//rate>
< Review>
This market was a fun experience! First we just walked up and down the aisles looking at all of the different food vendors. They have Asian, Mexican, pizza, pasta, breakfast, Indian, Mediterranean, and more! For some types of food, there is more than one option to choose from. There were at least 3 Mexican places, for example.Many places have counter seating, or there are areas with tables and chairs to sit at as well.</Review>

I'm a 56 year old, very active cyclist and gym rat, who loves to act as a kid. I had my first surgery in my life, removal of a one inch (big) torn piece of meniscus. Due to the outstanding reviews, I went to Live Athletics for my Physical Therapy.

Channing went right to work. She broke down scar tissue and pushed away lactic acid build-up. She had me try exercises that she knew I should be doing. < Review>
I've gone to Live Athletics for PT following a stress fracture and now again following shoulder surgery, and I would never go anywhere else.  Zach and Anthony are extremely knowledgeable and focused on their patients.  Anthony created a rehab program tailored to my needs and abilities. Stephanie, Casey and everyone else are wonderful, and I can already see a difference and hope it will prevent injury as I try to get back in shape. < Name>
Zach LaBar</Name>
< pics>
None</pics>
<Text>Physical Therapy that Cannot be Matched

Live Athletics is the most elite, well run P.T. that I've ever been a part of. Starting with the founder of the facility, Dr. Zac Ray offers the best quality work in various outlets of maintenance and recovery. I've lived in Northern and Southern California, and have experience with an endless quantity of physical therapy organizations. That said, Live Athletics does things differently. To reiterate this in a different fashion, they go about their business the RIGHT way. My throwing shoulder (QB) has never felt better, and by committing to their individually unique programs, health and performance improvement is practically guaranteed. I will be moving to a more distant location, but will maintain my participation at Live Athletics. < text>
So, I ended up with a full separation of my upper hamstring from the bone. Had surgery to have it repaired, which while it hurt at the time, was the easy part. Work was done by the SCOI which I was impressed with. They provided me with a short list of recommended physical therapy organizations and Live Athletics was around the top of that list. I am no spring chicken (43) but am quite active and really want my leg use back.

I have been coming to live athletics now for 2 months as has my 15 year daughter who plays soccer for the canarillo eagles. They did great work for her and I figured I too would give them a try. I have been very pleased with the work effort, both traditional and nontraditional therapy and the people are phenominal. Zach runs the place which is very open and he is constantly teaching new techniques to his staff and they work very well together. I personally have worked closely with Anthony, Kaylah and Stephanie and attest to the excellent work they do and the noticable difference it is having on me. There are also lots of assistants constantly helping and guiding and able to answer any questions you may have.

It is hard work but I am truly pleased with the people, knowledge and progress I have been able to make due to their excellence. If you have a need for physical therapy and a desire to do what you were able to do prior to your injury then LIVE ATHLETICS is the place for you. Thanks much LA!<//text>

< user_id>
116480324850720422399</user_id>
< name>
Luis Rivera< /name>
< date>
1573065084941<//date>
<Rate>1< /Rate>< Review>
For a company that pitched their highway scam as a means to "ease" drivers, they sure put in a lot of effort into purposefully making the whole process as difficult as possible. They have far more cameras than they have signs alerting you of tolls. If you're driving at night, good luck seeing them unless you know they are there. If you aren't familiar with the area, you'll be stuck on a "toll road" for miles. They have cameras everywhere and know exactly what part of their toll roads you used, which is why they send you violations through mail with the exact locations. But when you log into their website to pay, instead of just simply typing in your plate/violation number and seeing a total amount with the information provided on their mailed notification, they instead make it as painful as possible to ensure you make mistakes to charge you even more money. They expect you to know the entrance, the exit, what date you drove, what freeway you used etc. If you do not provide this EXACT information, they will not be able to calculate the fine, which leads most people to overpay for use of the whole freeway instead of chancing a mistake. They charge $100 per penalty on $2 tolls. If you do not pay, they will put a lien against your vehicle registration in the DMV. They are not set up for "ease" of use. They are set up to scam uniformed/out of state motorists. There is no reason any agency should be able to charge such outrageous fines on such small fees. Furthermore, they expect you to pay the fine you might not know about within 5 days or you incur penalties per violation. You're given 21 days to pay for traffic violations! No one asked for fines. No one asked for toll roads. We already pay taxes for these roads. Why are we paying for something we already paid for?! I can't believe these are legal business practices. Boycotting moving forward and you should too. These thieves need to be put out of business.<//Review>

<rating>5< /rating>< review>
I drove on the toll road last week knowing that I could call within 48-hours to pay for using the toll road.  I called within the time frame, and Daisy, my customer service rep, was quite helpful.  The charge was less than $7.00 -- had I not paid on time, the fee could have been over $200.00.  Although the toll only comes in handy for me perhaps twice a year, Daisy also helped me set up an account whereas if I drive the toll road in the future, the fee would be automatically deducted.  In this way, I would not have to worry about calling within the 48-hour period of time.  With this account, I can also add multiple cars -- This will super helpful for my sons and family who may be traveling during the holidays!  Thanks, Daisy!  I really appreciate being able to use the toll roads!<//review>

So, because these idiots can't afford to keep their toll booths open, we are forced to log on to their web site each time we need to use the toll road or suffer an insane fine. I was forced to use the toll road because of a road closure. When I got home I tried to pay the $6.31 toll. When I filled out the form, I got a pop up window that said "The Plate Entered Does Not Match Standard CA Plates.Are you Sure?" Since I have personalized plates I was pretty sure. I hit OK and it refused to continue with my payment. I tried calling the toll free number which took 30 minutes of my life that I will never get back. I was sent a fine of $115.00 for a $6.31 toll that their system wouldn't let me pay. I emailed in all the information of what happened and they sent me back an emailed response lowering the fine to $75.00. (Like they were doing me a favor) I used the toll road a total of 3 times in a two week period because of the road closure. Each time I tried to pay I got the same warning. When I called back and stayed on hold for over a half an hour. They offered to drop it to $20.00. Again, why would I pay one dime over what I originally owed them due to their system not recognizing my license plate. Oh, by the way, did I point out that my licences plate was spelled correctly on the fine I received. So it doesn't recognize my plate when I want to pay the $6.31 toll but it does recognize it to fine me $115.00. I asked for a manager. When he finally got on, he would only reduce it back to the original toll if I opened an on line account. WHAT A SCAM THEY HAVE GOING. He pointed out that I had previous fines. Oh, you mean back when you shut down the booths and I took the toll road and didn't know what the hell was going on?. Everyone got fines back then because of the confusion. When they used tax payers dollars to build this thing it was touted as a huge convenience. They have made this thing anything but convenient. I'm going to stick to the back roads to Jamboree or to the 55 frwy when I need to get to south county. I refuse to continue to support this inept company.</text>

< Review>
Nice folks running the place, clean, secure facility BUT they raise the rent every six months! After six months they raised my rent $5 a month and last month they bumped it an additional $11 a month. So I called and asked why. The answer was they compare what other local storage places are charging for similar sized units and then they change what they charge. Yes, the local Extra Space names their price, it‚Äôs not a corporate thing. So basically the local storage places can get together and collectively drive up prices. So What you may think is a get deal on storage initially will change on you, not might, it will, quickly. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs in the fine print in the contract.<//Review>

Was a little nervous to get a storage locker again, after the experience I had with my first one a few years back. But Jessica made it Super easy and fairly painless. They said that the insurance which they make you buy, doesn't cover damage to my items because of pests, that got into my unit. All they could say is "this is a new place and it used to be a field, so the mice were here first."  WHAT?????  I have been unable to move as I now live 6 hours away and disabled (waiting for my SSI) with no income. The unit is $140 a month. < Text>
We had a terrific experience with Watermark Home Loans and particularly with our Mortgage broker Jody Canfield. We used Watermark for a Jumbo Mortgage on a second home. We decided to go through the application process after Watermark was recommended to us and after getting a quote for a reasonable interest rate and closing costs.

The application process was straight forward and organized (all online) and Jody did a terrific job of guiding us through it. We very quickly got a pre-qualification letter.

When it came time to make an offer, Jody worked closely with our real estate broker to adjust things as needed and was very responsive.

During the closing process Jody helped us every step of the way, proactively requesting documentation and keeping us posted every step of the way. The upfront work made for a smooth close at the end, avoiding surprises.

Whenever we had questions along the way, Jody always made herself available quickly to answer questions or provide us with status. There was a real personal touch. Our real estate broker even commented on how extraordinary Jody was and how impressed they were with her.

We highly recommend Jody and Watermark Home Loans for your mortgage needs.<//Text>

<Rating>1< /Rating>< Review>
I have just shut down the process of refinancing with Watermark because they are clearly not an honest company. I was in the final stretch. Everything had been approved (the refinance was on a mortgage that is about 1/4 the value of the house), had paid for the home appraisal...and was told that because the appraiser they hired didn't get the information to them on time, I would be charged $2000 to maintain the locked in rate we had agreed upon. I have multiple properties and have financed and refinanced several. Never ONCE, ever, despite what their loan officer insisted on telling me was a common phenomenon, have I been asked to pony up more money because they couldn't process the loan within the 45 day lock period. Just to be clear, I responded to every one of their messages within 48 hours as they asked me for information. So at no moment did I slow the process down. It was only because of the company that they hired that we exceeded the 45 days. This is outright dishonesty and though I will now be charged a higher rate on my loan, and will have lost the money I already paid in, I can't work with a company that clearly won't play by the most basic rules of decency. If there is a problem with the appraising company, then Watermark should be asking them for the $2000. Otherwise, it's just robbery. Like I said, I can't give them, or their agent, my money. That would be supporting what is clearly a dishonest practice.< /Review>

<pictures>None</pictures><Response>None< /Response><Time>1604388550711< /Time><Review>The only word I can think of that accurately describes Watermark is "incompetent".

I initially contacted them in July of 2020 regarding a very straightforward refinance of my primary residence. The rate they offered was very good, so I immediately provided them with all required documentation to lock it in and shortly thereafter is when I encountered issue after issue...after issue.

First, was a complete lack of communication. Literally over a month passed at one point with not even a peep from them. When they would come out of the wood work, it was to request the same documents that I had already sent them - this happened multiple times. Really frustrating.

Then, when I finally thought they had their act together, they sent me updated disclosures and FINALLY provided a closing date. That date came and went with literally zero communication from anyone. I wrote them off at that point, but then...

Another month passed and they come out of the blue, yet again with updated disclosures that looked good, so I decided to give them another shot. A closing date and time was scheduled (again) and after scheduling my neighbor to come by to witness the signing and leaving my son's baseball practice early, I get a call from the closing attorney 15 minutes before the scheduled closing: no documents. Watermark failed to provide the closing documents to the attorney. Unbelievable.

Needless to say, I've now permanently blacklisted Watermark and refuse to do business with them both now and in the future. I've never in my life been jerked around so much by a company.

This experience might have actually been a blessing in disguise though because I've read that Watermark services some of their own loans. I can only imagine how awful that must be for their customers who are stuck dealing with them for years and decades on end. That said, I'll happily pay a half point more to work with a competent company who doesn't frustrate the daylights out of me at every turn.

Good riddance, Watermark!</Review></record></dataset><record>

<gmap_id>0x80dcdd63999c0305:0x1aa0edb7fe31452b</gmap_id><userid>105829425259465561573</userid>< date>
1599692938914</date>
< Text>
Ok, this is an interesting company to work with. The review is long and contains very useful information for anyone who is thinking of using this company for their mortgage needs.
I worked with Watermark back in 2015-16 to refinance my home, that time I did not have any issue and the transaction was smooth from start to finish.
Since then I have had two mortgages with Watermark. One day in March 2020 I received an email from Watermark to apply for refinance with NO Closing Cost. I replied to that email and asked what options are available (15yr & 30yr). I never received a response for that email but a few weeks later I received another email that is asking me to sign up for an account for recent application submitted and to review "Pre Disclosure". I reached out to the agent who contacted me through email for refinance but he never¬†responded. After receiving more emails about creating account and continuing the process of application, one day, I received a letter in mail stating that my credit score and report has been obtained by Watermark and they will use this credit report to make decision on my application. WATERMARK CHECKED MY CREDIT WITHOUT MY CONSENT. In reality I never applied for refinance and Watermark has already started my application to refi. I reached out to the agent by phone and email but he never responded. After few more days I decided to call their Irvine office and talk to his supervisor. I spoke to his supervisor and told the whole story - first he was thinking that I am a bogus customer but later after looking into my "submitted application" he realized that my first application from 2016 was resubmitted with same loan amount (which is over 100k higher than correct amount). He then offered me refinance with current loan amount and low interest rate and no closing cost. When I created new application as per his instructions, I was NOT offered "NO COST" refi but the cost was over $5000.00 including existing HELOC subordination fee. Fine, the process started but it grew painful by the time, their system does not understand password protected pdfs so I had to email sensitive files. After two months of back and forth I decided to refi my other home which is a rental single family home. I was offered slightly higher APR as it was an investment property - it was definitely lower than current APR tho. While they were working on my primary home refi they contacted HELOC provider and failed to strike a deal that forced me to either obtain an inspection or sign¬†"Voluntary Suspension of Line". Before signing this document and tried to convince Watermark to waive the cost of inspection but the response from the loan office was "What?? you want me pay for inspection?"(sic). And I was also told that if I do not either spend money to get my own inspection or sign that document the deal will fall apart and refi will not happen. I had to sign the document since I was already trapped by Watermark. In July I was informed about closing and was told to schedule time for document signup with a Notary. The first scheduled time no one showed up so we setup another time next week. This time the notary showed up and we spent about 1.5 hours signing up closing documents. After signing was done I was told I will be contacted by the company again for closing refi on other house. Two weeks later I received a call to schedule another appointment with a Notary for closing, we scheduled a day and time for the same. When Notary arrived I was shocked to see that she had paperwork for both the houses - we did not know what to do. I showed her a copy of the closing documents that I already signed a couple of weeks ago. We then reached out to Watermark to see what this drama is, then I was told that the previous closing did not happen and they "thought" that I was informed by "someone" at Watermark. Fine.. I again signed up the closing document and this time it was properly closed.
Continued on attached pics as "character limit reached in this review..."< /Text>

<Time>1594491268263</Time><name>Ella Minnow Pea< /name><Rate>1<//Rate>< text>
Fairly disappointing high pressure / low service mortgage broker. Initial conversations included veiled threats that "mortgage rates won't be this low again" - they were and, after closing, are even lower. Instead of honest discussions about what I was being told by other brokers, they just insisted that I didn't understand what was being offered. The broker insisted my application wouldn't target a hard credit pull, which was a lie. I should have switched brokers at that point, but once you start the paperwork process, it's hard to walk away knowing they have all your personal information.

The process took 57 days on a very simple refinance from lock to funding and I only found out everything was okay by receiving a system generated email after funding. During processing and underwriting, there was rarely communication or movement without me prodding. If you use them, I'd suggest calling every day to make sure things are moving. When I did contact them, the responses were often inaccurate or unrelated to my question. They sent me someone else's tax return at one point because they mixed me up with someone else. I indicated that I wanted to pay closing costs out of pocket, but they rolled them into the loan and didn't respond to my emails asking about it. Perhaps their commissions are based on loan values. The closing disclosures weren't accurate and the signing was done with a notary who didn't have specific information on my file so asking questions wasn't an option without creating further delays. There were numerous other small issues along the way. The refinance did complete, but I wouldn't work with them again after the experience.</text>

< text>
I have had nothing short of the BEST experience using Watermark home loans for my refinance! My Loan Officer, Jody Canfield truly went above and beyond throughout the entire process. I originally had 3 different lenders that I was working with and she was the only one who would answer every question I asked, continue to give me market rate updates, and was NOT ever pushy with trying to get me to lock.  I cannot say the same for the other lenders.

Jody was extremely courteous and up front when I was going through the tedious process of trying to find "the best" option between the three lenders.  She would make sure to explain to me the differences between each offer as well as reminding me that each lender is generally looking out for their best interests and could try to twist the numbers to make theirs look the best (making sure I knew which numbers were the same between all offers and which numbers could change).

Long story short, I couldn't be happier that Jody was my loan officer throughout the entire process.  I would STRONGLY recommend her to anyone looking for a refinance!< /text>

< time>
1589990307016< /time>
< gmap_id>
0x80dcdd63999c0305:0x1aa0edb7fe31452b< /gmap_id>
< text>
Trying to interact with Watermark on a home refinance¬†was like unknowing being drug into the Pit of Dispair in The Princess Bride. Each week was a new, creative torture seemingly designed to suck years off of my life. I would hope I am a considerate person who recognizes when circumstances are out of someone's control and act reasonably. I also like to think I focus on the positive, giving people the benefit of the doubt and even praising my local DMV recently when the experience went really, really well.¬†That said when a company seems to have little regard for someone's time or money I think it is also reasonable to let others know to be aware. With the recent record-low mortgage rates I applied through Watermark for a refinance on my home. I tend to be well organized and had all of my paperwork in order and went through the initial process in less than 30 minutes. I was contacted by a Watermark representative, who I don't think is fair to name here as he seemed to be following company policy rather than his own direction, to confirm my information and tell me they were experiencing a high volume of applications on so this might take a few weeks. I understood and followed up each week to see if they needed anything more from me. Each week I was assured all was well and that my loan would be reviewed shortly. After four weeks I was told my loan was moving forward and I needed to arrange for a home appraisal. I chose to use one of the companies Watermark recommended, arranged and paid the $400 for the appraisal.¬†I did not hear back from Watermark after I received confirmation of the appraisal and followed up a week later. I was again told all was fine with the loan process but underwriting was backed up and my loan was delayed. I followed up again the following week and was given the same response. On the seventh¬†week since submitting my application and "locking in my rate" I followed up again. I did not receive an immediate response. The following day I was sent an email informing me Watermark was no longer willing to process my refinance unless I paid an additional $2000 to continue the process. This is in addition to the fees they are taking to process the loan.If they had told me 2-3 weeks earlier I could have adjusted and moved to another company but mortgage rates had climbed again and I would not be able to lock in a rate that made sense to refinance. It feels like a scam and a big company trying to hold an individual hostage after striking them along.I told Watermark I no longer wanted to move forward with them and I would like a refund for the home inspection I paid for under their advice¬†all was moving forward. They told me to pound sand. I feel like I was reasonable in asking for additional consideration considering the circumstances and received the same reply that if I wanted to move forward they would be happy to process my loan but that I needed to pay the additional $2000 but they would not refund me for the home inspection.¬†After being drug along I choose to cut my losses but thought you should understand this companies business practices and decide if you want to risk being tortured by the six fingers man.
Anigo Montoya(Scott J.)<//text>

<GmapID>0x80dcdd63999c0305:0x1aa0edb7fe31452b<//GmapID><user_id>114797175093599382309< /user_id><Resp>None<//Resp><name>Chris Parks</name><Review>Amanda Blankenship and her whole team at Watermark home loans were nothing short of incredible through my whole home buying process. Believe all of the 5 star reviews!... There is a reason almost everybody loves this place. Amanda was so professional and dedicated the whole time to getting me the best loan possible on the house of my dreams. She found me the lowest rate known to man in our current market and got me very competitively low lender fee's. She came through for us in the clutch on nights and weekends during critical stages of the closing process, and even answered emails while on her long deserved vacation. She had me almost fully underwritten and approved when we went to go look at houses, and we were able to get into contract on one that weekend! Her and her team were so fast and efficient that we were ready to close 10 days early (but couldn't because of the seller). If you are on the fence about using Watermark, like I was, reading reviews trying to figure out if They're too good to be true... trust me, they're not too good to be true, they really are that good. Just take the leap of faith... you'll be happy you did. And if you are lucky enough to get Amanda as your loan officer... you are in for one smooth ride!!!< /Review><rate>5</rate>< pictures>

< Text>
My refinance went very well.  Overall a fast process comparatively speaking, without any hassle of ever having to leave the house.  Start to finish less than a month, and it was done, which is terrific.  Very good interest rates, though higher than typical closing costs...but the low rates offset the higher closing costs.  They offered the best rates I could find anywhere.  There was a certain amount of duplication involved...we would send requested paperwork, then 3 days later they would ask for the same paperwork again...so we would simply send it again.  At times it seemed the left hand didn't know what the right hand was doing and they were a bit disorganized between the different assistants who were helping with various aspects of the job.  Otherwise it was not terrible and didn't cause any undue stress...but probably an extra 1/2 hour to hour of additional fiddling around on the computer that was entirely unnecessary.    FYI before I have even made my first payment, they sold my mortgage to another company...this is not a complaint, just a statement of fact.  It is common in the industry.  But if something like that might bother you, look elsewhere.  I frankly don't care that they sold my mortgage immediately as it doesn't impact me, just a little surprising it happened less than 3 weeks after closing!  Overall I would recommend them.  Casey was very responsive and helpful thru the entire process, and I have only those few small complaints about duplication of effort that prevented the 5 star rating they otherwise could have earned.< /Text>

<Text>My experience with Watermark Home Loans on my refi w/cashout was stress free - despite the Chrismas and New Year Holdays.  Thomas Cross was my Mortgage Banker.  He was extremely polite and patient.  For a week before Christmas, I emailed my questions and Mr Cross, without skipping a beat, responded with clarity.  If I didn't understand something, he would politely explain.  I didn't feel pressured at all and he was acommodating with my request to conduct communication via email.  I felt he was very upfront and honest with his approach. When I was ready to move forward, he had my rate locked in the next business day. 3 business days later, after submitting my required documents, I was in contact with a Loan Officer. Less than 2 wks, I received a "Conditional Approval". After I cleared up a few questions, I received my Closing package to review and accept.  4 business days later, I was sitting in front of a notary signing the actual loan docs. And another 4 business day after that, my account was funded and I received my cashout checks in my hands.  I have done worked with other brokers and loan officers in the past, but none of these experiences came close to that of Watermark.  In my opinion, I would recommend. < review>
Very, very good experience I've had while working on refinance with Watermark. My contact was Martin Franco. Nothing but positive feedback I can provide. The key points:
- Most of the communication and paperwork is done online;
- Fast feedback
- Competitive rates (no one gave me a better ones)
- Fast closing (it took less then 1 month from the initial contact to the very end)
I would definitely recommend this company to anyone who is looking for refinance deal.</review>

<UserId.>106092903544020951357</UserId.><Name>Matt Harlow< /Name><Date>1576881362027< /Date>< Rate>
1<//Rate>
< review>
Avoid Watermark loans at all costs!! Especially Martin C Franco & Mike Greenberg.

My wife and I were purchasing our first home and shopped around for an interest rate on a Jumbo ~1m+ loan for beach cities townhome. Although our real estate agent recommended other lenders, Watermark came back with a competitive rate and were prompt to get us the pre-approval letter - a decision we later regretted.

Things seemed to be going well for the first two weeks of the 30 day close, until Martin dropped a laundry list of 'outstanding' items that he still needed even though he had previously confirmed all the documentation was uploaded. Annoying, but not a huge problem. We promptly uploaded the documentation after several back and forths / technical difficulties with their upload server.

So we are two weeks out from close and I ask Martin to confirm we are all on track to meet the closing date. He promptly replies yes - no worries.

A day passes and he asks for $250 fee that needs to get paid to the 'HOA' for them to fill out a questionnaire. He states 'This is handled by escrow, but they want us to do it', which we thought was weird and we were not expecting this but filled out the credit card form for Watermark.
The next day we receive the loan disclosures and it clearly states that only $150 is needed for the HOA fee, so we have to go through an entire series of communication to get our $100 back ... painful, but not a huge deal in the scheme of things.

But then the fun begins. Note it was 10 days before closing and we thought we were all good as confirmed by Martin. Then the week we are supposed to close he calls and says we are going to miss the closing date because the 'HOA questionnaire' is not complete. This is the same questionnaire that we had just paid $150 for two weeks prior. Maybe it was a bad assumption that this would 'get done', but either way we had paid Watermark to get this done and they had failed to do so.

So we worked with our real estate agent to move out the close date. Initially Watermark said it would only be a day or two, but it ended up being an entire week.

On top of all of this, they said it was going to cost an extra $3100 (.36% of the loan) due to them missing the closing date. I fought this tooth and nail since the delay was directly their fault, but it was pretty clear when I got on the phone with Martin's boss Mike that this was how Watermark turns a profit - by ripping off their customers.

Lots of lessons learned from our first house purchase - hopefully this review will help save someone the stress and money of dealing with Watermark.</review>

< review>
Watch out for the Lenders credit along the entire process. The underwriters delayed every step they could which resulted in us having to have Watermark extend the locked interest rate twice. Of course at no point did they tell me that it was going to cost me to keep the rate that I was losing due to their dragging their feet. We submitted the application and all requested paperwork within 48 hours on 5/4 and we didn't get the closing paperwork until 6/29. I didn't see that the $721 credit was only $192 at closing and had no choice but to sign the paperwork for other legal obligations. I had called and questioned this before signing and of course couldn't get in touch with the lending agent. He never replied until he had the signed paperwork in hand.  Also watch for the appraisal amount. We had approved and signed for a $550 appraisal but $700 was charged to our card.
We lost $679 due to Watermarks lack of knowledge. Look elsewhere.</review>

< Review>
If you are looking for someone to go over and beyond, has loads of patience, and has tons of knowledge, you want Rob Kromberg!  I chose Rob to take care of my mortgage needs after interviewing many brokers and researching many offers in the cyber world.  I based my decision on his vast knowledge, his patience with my never ending questions, and yes, he offered the best rates out there!  Buying a home with Rob felt more like a ‚Äúteam‚Äù endeavor, than a business transaction.  The whole time he looked out for my best interests, even when he had nothing more to gain.  It took me 6 months to find my home, which included lots of questions and new pre-approval letters.  The market and rates kept changing, but with no questions asked, he provided me with everything for the entire 6 months.  When I finally found my dream home, Rob and team walked me through every step of the way.  He even found additional options for more credit back at close!  I am most grateful of Rob,  how when my credit score unexpectedly dropped at the crucial time, due to an unjust billing error,  he was in there contacting the bureaus and everyone he knew, to help me get it fixed as fast as possible. My wife and I had a great experience using Watermark. We worked with Dominic and Genelle  and it was a pleasure.
When we were in the process of purchasing our home we first started with another lender who made us a bunch of promises but was unable to deliver when push came to shove. I started researching online and I found Watermark, good reviews and good rates. I contacted them and I explained our situation. My wife (the breadwinner) was pregnant and on disability leave, our assets were in overseas banks, part of the down payment was going to be gifted to us and the clock was ticking. They looked at all the info and they told us they could do it within the time we had left. Communication was great, Dominic and Genelle were pro-active in letting us know what documentation was required and in anticipating what else Underwriting might need. We closed on time, we got a great rate and fees were very reasonable.

Fast forward 9 months and rates had dipped a little compared to when we got our mortgage. Dominic looked into it and he said Watermark could refi the loan at no cost to us to a rate that was 0.125% lower.
We agreed and the process was so easy, it only took me a couple of hours. They had our info so they just needed a couple of updated paystubs and we had to sign some papers. Everything went incredibly smooth and our loan funded today. Not only did our rate go down, we actually ended up with an extra $600 in our pocket. Easiest money I ever made! I highly recommend Watermark.</text>

Update: Based on Watermark's efforts to make things right after failing to come through initially, I have upgraded my overall rating from 2 to 3 stars.  Several days after closing the property purchase with private financing (Watermark failed to fund within the escrow period), got a call from a principal at Watermark, Chuck Dragna, apologizing for the frustration I experienced and asked if I would consider allowing Watermark to provide delayed financing (which is simply refinancing). He seemed sincere, and if it could be done at a good rate and cost, it would meet my needs. Chuck was very frank that he was concerned about the poor reviews I posted to Yelp and Google. Well there you go, yay for Yelp and Google reviews. Without them, probably would not have ever gotten the guys attention. At any rate, a painful four months after my initial application, we did complete the deal at a competitive rate with some small concessions on cost. Hence, the upgrade on stars.

Original review: Worst financing experience I've had in 30 years of buying, selling, and refinancing homes.  Wife and I both have 800+ FICO scores, an unblemished 30 year credit history, good income, and plenty of assets. In spite of that, It was virtually a full-time job for weeks keeping up with their ceaseless requests for additional documentation, letters of explanation, etc., etc..

Granted, my income is somewhat unconventional and there were some minor complications with the property being purchased.  But nothing that should have created the endless back and forth that we experienced. Watermark just couldn't see the forest for the tress. I ran out of patience and pulled the plug. Fortunately we had other options, or Watermark's dithering could have easily scuttled both a sales and a purchase transaction.

Their fees and rates were competitive, but I guess you get what you pay for.  My recommendation is to stay away unless you are looking for the most conventional of conventional financing.<//text>

<date>1547820902415< /date><pictures>None</pictures><Text>Ron and Genelle were both great to work with! Ron was the most transparent and educating mortgage banker that I "interviewed" in my search and, as a first-time home buyer, I needed both of those qualities in a lender. In our first conversation he did not assume that I already knew everything about the mortgage process, like others did; instead, he patiently and thoroughly explained details like:
--what is and is not included in closing costs
--what points are, and how both points and lender credits are acquired and affect your interest rate

Ron was always quick to respond to emails and, early on, told me to let him know if any concerns came up. My realtor did raise a concern with a past transaction he'd had with Watermark so I shared that concern with Ron and, while the transaction was not one of his, he acknowledged the concern and sought out some background. He then provided a detailed explanation of what occurred and how we could avoid the same issue.

Genelle, my loan processor, has some great project management skills! She provided a clear list of the items I needed for underwriting, frequently checked in on progress, and quickly answer my questions.

It can be a bit tricky working with folks in opposite time zones (I'm on ET while Watermark is on PT), but Ron and Genelle were pleasant and professional and we closed on schedule and that's what matters in the end!<//Text>< gmapID>

It's not often these days that we encounter a company that delivers excellent customer service and follows through on what they promised. 1506995319708</Date>
</record>
</dataset><record>
<Gmap_id>0x80dcdd63999c0305:0x1aa0edb7fe31452b< /Gmap_id>< review>
I see a lot of good reviews on here, but I notice that most of them are for refinances, which tend to be lower risk than first-time mortgages (because the person has already qualified for a mortgage in the past).

I made the mistake of trusting watermark and the loan officer, Kory Mathys, for the loan on my first home. I was told that the poor reviews on here were only from people who didn't submit the requested documents on time, and that he could easily secure my loan before closing of the 30 day escrow.

I had been rate shopping for loans for weeks and the best I could find for the condo we were buying was 4.65%
Kory told me he could get me 4.375%
The union bank loan officer told me that sounded "too good to be true" and that "online banks are known for not delivering." He would probably say "I told you so!" if he spoke to me now, because he was right.

Despite having great credit scores, very little debt, and sending every document I was asked for promptly, they ended up screwing me over. Everything was moving smoothly until the day before I had to remove contingencies from my purchase contract, when I was informed they would not be able to approve my loan. Kory told me to the bitter end that "technically" I had indeed been approved but that I just "couldn't satisfy the conditions." Well that is just double speak, either you're approved or you're not... if the conditions weren't satisfied then I wasn't approved, period. If I had trust him and removed the contingencies,  I would have lost my $8000 deposit and the house as well once the financing had fallen through.

I know I'm a reliable borrower, and the proof is in the pudding, as I ended up getting a loan with a different bank (with a slightly higher interest rate of 4.65% on the loan) and there was no issue with the underwriting in this case. I'm fortunate that I was able to have family lend me money to close on the deal and then secure my loan after the fact. Otherwise, I would have had cancel the contract and would have lost the money from the home inspection and the appraisal, which was almost $1000.

Be wary of a deal that seems too good to be true. To quote Mark Twain, "A banker is a fellow who lends you his umbrella when the sun is shining, but wants it back the minute it begins to rain."

Watermark made a big mistake with their dishonesty and lack of transparency. As a physician, my earning potential in the future is high, and I will never use watermark in the future and I will be sure to tell all my colleagues to avoid them as well.< /review>

<userid>106620712938208657260<//userid><name>Mike Payne</name><date>1509469812997<//date>< Rating>
5<//Rating>
< text>
My Realtor had cautioned me against using "Internet lenders," so I had been working with 3 local lenders.  Once we were under contract, I decided to check Bankrate to compare rates, and Watermark came up with a rate almost half a point lower than what I had been offered, with no lender's fees.  I quickly applied and Martin Franco called me the next day.  I truly can say their services was on par with any local lender I had worked with in the past.  Martin was extremely responsive and Sandra Dodd was in the background pushing things along.  We ran into a snafu 2 weeks before closing because of a credit item we weren't aware of, but Martin helped me work through this quickly.  Overall I am very happy with our decision to use Watermark - and to top it off, I was just informed they will be servicing our loan and not selling it, which we are happy about.< /text>

< review>
Liars - They'll entice you with low rate than raise them at the last second.
We were told we could get locked in for a loan at about 4.1% then strung along with the preapproval, required to send tons of paperwork, more than other companies, and told once it was all sent we could lock in that rate. I'd follow up with David and he'd say I needed to send more information (not originally requested) before we could lock in the rate. I'd send it ASAP. He sent a preapproval letter without an interest rate (which I've never seen done before), but he was holding out so the rates would go up. Now he's giving me a higher quote than many other companies I've worked with. Their fees are also much higher than other companies. When I tried to discuss why information was changing so drastically regarding our rate which seemed suspicious, he told me to "apologize to him" since he doesn't control the loan market... HA! Well lying about rates and not disclosing our preapproval rate as different than what was originally presented to us until after the offer we placed on a house was accepted is pretty controlling. I called this company because of their good reviews, but now I'm weary that most of these are from people who work there or something. I've never worked with a company like this.</review>

<userid>116160400756495252799<//userid><user_name>rakesh kumar< /user_name><time>1545087759478< /time><Rating>5</Rating><review>Excellent service!

For me watermark loans is the best lender I have come across during my house hunting process.  And I would like to say special thanks to the entire team that have helped me to get my first home, especially Philippe.
Philippe is a very nice person and knows his job very well. He is very prompt in returning responses and he won't lie or hide facts just to get the business. The rate offered by watermark home loans were very competitive and there was a huge difference in closing costs compared
to other lenders, especially brick-n-mortar banks. I was surprised to see even difference in the PMI. Thanks to Philippe and his team. They made our house closing process very easy and closed 5 days earlier than the initial estimated closing date. If I will need loan again then I will come to watermark loans as long as Philippe is there.

But, only thing I didn't like about watermark loans was their on-line portal interface. They need to work on this interface and need to make it more interactive.  Their website won't show any progress or status on the loan application or document submit status, but thanks to Philppe, he was updating me regularly.  If in this digital world, we need to rely and wait on communication from the representative we are working with then this is something serious and needs an immediate attention. I won't blame them entirely though because 99% lenders I came across uses ellie mae tools for mortgage application, and this suit properly for the phrase "you get what you pay for."

Thanks watermark team!< /review><Pictures>None<//Pictures><resp>None</resp>< gmapID>
